org.morphus.stereo

Interface Camera

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StereoCamera

    public interface Camera
    Left and right Camera view specified by given Camera.Channel.

    The concept of camera does not exist in OpenGL, what this class does is create a frustum according to the given MoConfig and then attaches it to the desired Camera.Channel

    The channels, LEFT & RIGHT views will later be combined in the scene renderer to create the illusion of depth by means of stereopsis for binocular vision.

    The view that the camera is going to generate is controlled by the MoConfig.

    Author:
    In Aikun Electronics., Ahmed Shakil, Carolina Prieto Mu√±iz
    See Also:
    Camera.Channel, MoConfig
    Create Date
    12-19-2013

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Camera.Channel
      Stereoscopic channel corresponding to the left and right eye of the viewer.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        void create(Camera.Channel channel,
          MoConfig config)
        Construct camera with the specified stereo channel and the desired sdk configuration. This method will be called only once when surface is created.
        Parameters:
        channel - StereoChannel stereoscopic channel
        config - MoConfig SDK system configuration file

      • setup

        void setup(float iod,
         float aspect)
        Setup the projection parameters everytime the surface changes.
        Parameters:
        iod - viewer's inter ocular distance.
        aspect - Aspect ratio

      • apply

        void apply(float[] matrix)
        Apply projection to the project matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Projection matrix

      • getChannel

        Camera.Channel getChannel()
        Get stereoscopic channel associated to this camera
        Returns:
        StereoChannel associated to this camera
